definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

Yellow Crane Tower in Wuhan City, built in 223, burnt down in 1884, rebuilt in 1985/favored place of poet sages, who in legend arrived riding golden cranes/Tang poem by Cui Hao 崔顥|崔颢[Cui1 Hao4], with theme 'the past will never return'/one of three famous pagodas in China along with Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓|岳阳楼[Yue4 yang2 Lou2] in Yueyang, north Hunan, and Tengwang Tower 滕王閣|滕王阁[Teng2 wang2 Ge2] in Nanchang, Jiangxi
(bird species of China) Siberian crane (Grus leucogeranus)
(bird species of China) red-crowned crane (Grus japonensis)
a crane in a flock of chicken (idiom); way above the common/manifestly superior
lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
Hegang prefecture-level city in Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1] in northeast China
Hegang prefecture-level city in Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1] in northeast China
Heshan district of Hebi city 鶴壁市|鹤壁市[He4 bi4 shi4], Henan/Heshan county level city in Jiangmen 江門|江门, Guangdong
(bird species of China) black-necked crane (Grus nigricollis)
Hefeng county in Enshi Tujia and Miao autonomous prefecture 恩施土家族苗族自治州[En1 shi1 Tu3 jia1 zu2 Miao2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Hubei
Heshan county level city in Jiangmen 江門|江门, Guangdong

sentences.english: Image CreditWhen reduced to begging in enclaves of humanity, the birds can often lose some of the wildness.
sentences.chinese: 在人类居住地乞食的鹤鸵渐渐的就会失去野性。

sentences.english: At once she changed into a crane and opening her beautiful wings, she flew up into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 阿姿即刻变成了一只鹤，张开漂亮的翅膀飞向天空。

sentences.english: Zhalong is the ideal home for cranes and many other endangered birds.
sentences.chinese: 扎龙是鹤和其它濒危鸟类的理想栖息地。

sentences.english: The Dickey County project is outside the cranes' normal migratory flight path.
sentences.chinese: 美洲鹤正常迁徙飞行线路没有经过迪基县的项目。

sentences.english: Sandhill cranes lay their eggs in the northern state of Wisconsin.
sentences.chinese: 沙丘鹤在威斯康新州北部产卵。

sentences.english: Then the crane flew high into the sky.
How many wild whooping cranes are there?
sentences.chinese: 还有多少野生的美洲鹤？

sentences.english: So the crane permitted the crab to grab onto his neck with all eight legs.
sentences.chinese: 因此鹤答应了让螃蟹用八只脚抓住它的脖子。

sentences.english: As rabbit held crane's legs, its weight stretched4 crane's legs long.
sentences.chinese: 兔子抓着鹤的双腿，他自身的重量把鹤的腿都抻长了。

sentences.english: As rabbit held crane's legs, its weight stretched4 crane's legs long.
sentences.chinese: 兔子抓着鹤的双腿，他自身的重量把鹤的腿都抻长了。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there was a crane who lived near a small pond.
sentences.chinese: 从前，在一个小池塘边上住着一只鹤。

sentences.english: Then there have been a lot of legends and stories about cranes. Red-crowned Crane can live as long as 60 years.
sentences.chinese: 有不少关于鹤的传说和典故。

sentences.english: Cranes are large birds with long legs and necks.
sentences.chinese: 鹤是一种有着长长的腿和脖子的鸟。

sentences.english: Crane is a kind of bird with very long legs and neck.
sentences.chinese: 鹤是一种腿和脖子都很长的鸟。

sentences.english: Erh-lang turned into a huge sea crane and pursued the crow.
sentences.chinese: 二郎神急抖翎毛，摇身变作大海鹤，钻上云霄来啄。

sentences.english: I am the heaviest crane of the cranes (weighing up to 24 pounds or 11kg).
sentences.chinese: 我也是所有鹤种中最重的鹤。

definition: (bird species of China) Siberian crane (Grus leucogeranus)
